title: George Ford has asserted himself and is in position to become England's pre-eminent fly-half
text:
The only way for George Ford is up, and the only way for poor Owen Farrell is down as opponents go for his jawline. The more senior player, England’s captain is doing well to stay on the pitch at this World Cup while Ford, his old friend and rival, orchestrates events with increasing authority in the contested No 10 shirt.

The stories of Ford and Farrell are so intertwined they might as well be brothers. But there is nagging rivalry there too, with the fly-half jersey being the back line’s most coveted. Eddie Jones, the England coach, has settled on a formula here in Japan with Ford at 10 and Farrell at 12 (inside centre). The pair are in the top drawer of first and second receivers but while...
description: The only way for George Ford is up, and the only way for poor Owen Farrell is down as opponents go for his jawline.
